attributes.action: The petition calls on MPs to vote against the draft "Brexit" agreement.
attributes.background: In 2017, David Davis, (then Brexit Secretary), set out the government's objectives for "Brexit" negotiations. Keir Starmer, MP has  subsequently identified “six tests” to measure whether these objectives had been achieved. The draft agreement does not meet these objectives.

rejection.details:
How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote to vote against the agreement. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
